results.title: The Return of Martin Guerre = Le Retour de Martin Guerre
results.creator_credit: Daniel Vigne, Marcel Dassault Productions, FR3 and SFP
results.brief_description: In rural France during the Hundred Years’ War, an unhappy young man (Gerard Depardieu) vanishes from his village leaving his wife and his farm behind. Nine years later he returns a changed person, ostensibly having fought in the war. Though his appearance has altered beyond recognition, his wife (Nathalie Baye), finding him a much better lover and more responsible man than the one that left, accepts him wholeheartedly. Yet the villagers who knew him suspect he is not the man he claims to be, even though he possesses an insider’s knowledge of their lives. Matters come to a head when charges of deception are laid against him and Guerre is forced to defend his identity or face a death sentence. The ensuing court case of raises questions about the nature of identity, memory, perception, and how the passage of time can blur all three. This film was remade in Hollywood under the title “Sommersby” (1993) (also held in the collection). In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Rhapsody in August = Hachigatsu no kyshikyoku
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Hisao Kurosawa and Kurosawa Productions
results.brief_description: In this moving and thought-provoking film, four Japanese teenagers begin a voyage of discovery when their parents travel to Hawaii leaving them in the care of their grandmother, Kane. The elderly woman painfully recalls the death of her husband, and the horrors inflicted on the Japanese people when the atomic bomb was dropped on Nagasaki during World War II. Through her recollections her grandchildren learn the importance of remembering the past and of placing blame on war itself as opposed to the foreigners who waged it. It is a lesson that is challenged when her Japanese-American nephew arrives from America. His attitudes and opinions reveal that the relationship between Japan and America is far more complicated than a simple matter of understanding and forgiveness. Kurosawa’s subject here is the process of memory and commemoration, played out by different generations of Japanese on both the personal and social levels. Cast includes Richard Gere, Sachiko Murase, Hisashi Igawa and Narumi Kayashima.

results.title: Absolute beginners
results.creator_credit: Julien Temple, Chris Brown, Stephen Woolley, Goldcrest Films, Virgin Films and Palace Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in London in 1958, this unconventional rock musical is based on Colin MacInnes’ cult novel about emerging teen culture and racial tension in London circa 1958. Told from the perspective of eighteen year old Colin, a budding photographer and jazz fan, the film takes the viewer on a nostalgic, stylised trip into the social and cultural milieu of Soho and Notting Hill. The story revolves around Colin’s thwarted relationship with Suzette, who works for a chic couturier in Mayfair. Inspired by the artifice of Classic Hollywood musicals, director Julien Temple, who had previously made a name filming rock videos, gives this genre a visually inventive and energetic twist. The film features an impressive one-take opening sequence a la ‘Touch of Evil’, a string of dazzling production numbers set to a jazz inflected score by Gil Evans and a cast that includes David Bowie, Sade, Ray Davies, James Fox and Patsy Kensit.

results.title: Ratcatcher [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Lynne Ramsay, Gavin Emerson, BBC Film Unit and Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow in the early seventies when the city was in the midst of a garbage strike, “Ratcatcher” is an evocative and powerful examination of working class life seen through the eyes of twelve year old James Gillespie (William Eadie). When the film begins James inadvertently finds himself the cause of a friend’s drowning. Living with this secret becomes increasingly difficult and he dreams of an escape from his life on a council housing estate, and an escape from the guilt he feels over his friend’s death. Realism is one of the strengths, historically, of British cinema and Ramsay’s film is both a taking off from the pioneer work of filmmakers such as Anderson, Loach and Leigh, as well as a poetic extension of this tradition. There is bleakness and sadness in “Ratcatcher”, but there are also moments of startling beauty and humanity. Ramsey is particularly good at suggesting the world as seen through a child’s eye, as well as detailing the clumsiness and awkward emotions of adolescent sexuality. With the most economic of means, Ramsay immediately immerses the audience in the textures and sounds of 1970s Glasgow. Most importantly, without didactism, without bombast, she eloquently gives voice to the immensity of suffering bought on by poverty; and moves us with a poignant testament to the dignity of human struggle. Cast also includes Tommy Flanagan and Mandy Matthews.

results.title: Close encounters of the third kind [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Michael Phillips, Julia Phillips, Victor Vasarely, EMI/Parlophone and Columbia
results.brief_description: Roy Neary (Richard Dreyfuss) witnesses the arrival of flying saucers from an alien world. Thus begins an incredible series of events, culminating in the ultimate encounter with other worldly beings as Neary is led aboard the awesome mothership. Humans and aliens have made peaceful contact. Spielberg has replaced certain scenes with previously unreleased footage and expanded the dimensions of special effects with a breathtaking new ending that takes the viewer inside the dazzling Mothership and beyond the outer reaches of the imagination. Cast also includes Teri Garr and a special appearance by Francois Truffaut as Lacombe.

results.title: The Last starfighter
results.creator_credit: Nick Castle, Edward Denault, Gary Adelson, Universal Pictures and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: A highly underrated science fiction produced in the wake of the Star Wars phenomenon, “The Last starfighter” is another supreme example of outer-space/fantasy that was the trend in Hollywood in the early 1980s. Lance Guest is Alex Rogan, who lives and works a dead-end job in his mother’s trailer park. His only escape: a video-game called “Starfighter”. When a mysterious stranger explains to him that “Starfighter” is more than just a game, Alex is thrust centrestage for a conflict that threatens not only Earth but the entire universe. With production design by Ron Cobb (of ‘Alien’ and ‘Star Wars’ fame) and a scorching soundtrack by Craig Safan, “The Last starfighter” is formulaic Hollywood at its most entertaining. Cast also includes Robert Preston, Dan O’Herlihy, Catherine Stewart and Barbara Bosson.

results.title: Varsity blues
results.creator_credit: Brian Robbins, Mike Tollin, Tova Laiter and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Eager to prove he is more than just another soap star, James Van Der Beek agreed to the title role of Jonathan “Mox” Moxton in this coming of age film set in Texas. Mox is a reluctant gridiron fullback in the West Canaan Coyotes who discovers his brilliance for the game after being called in to substitute for injured star player Lance Harbor (Paul Walker). Mox is not thrilled at being pushed into the limelight as it means undue attention from masochistic Coach Kilmer (Jon Voight) - eager to win the 23rd district trophy, increased pressure from his father who is using Mox to live out his own unfulfilled sporting aspirations, and grief from his girlfriend who says that Mox is deluding himself by being a football hero. Things come to a head on the eve of the final when Mox is blackmailed by Coach Kilmer into play the game “his way” or face the prospect of remaining in their one horse town when he sabotages Mox’s chance at taking up his university offer. Cast also includes Ron Lester, Scott Caan, Ali Larter and Amy Smart.

results.title: Johnny Suede
results.creator_credit: Tom Di Cillo, Ruth Waldburger, Yoram Mandel, Starr Pictures, Arena Films and Balthazar Pictures
results.brief_description: An independent off-beat cult classic about an aspiring rock musician with a complicated love life and an obsession for suede and his own carefully cultivated self-image. Johnny (Brad Pitt) is a naive but endearing musician who models himself on the 1950s pop legend, Ricky Nelson. After a pair of black suede shoes fall on him from the sky one night, he adopts the name Johnny Suede and spends his time composing inspired love songs on his guitar that add greatly to the comic and somewhat bizarre quality of the film as he dreams of rock ‘n’ roll stardom. He meets the sensuous painter Yvonne (Catherine Keener) and begins a journey of self discovery that will never quite leave his carefully fabricated image the same again, or will it? Written and directed by Tom DiCillo, who followed this genuine and beautifully odd ball effort with ‘Living in Oblivion’(1994), said to be inspired in part by his experiences in making this film, and including a cast that features Nick Cave and Tina Louise. (Awards: Golden Leopard Award for Best Film, 1991)

results.title: The Story of Qiu ju = Qiuju da guan si
results.creator_credit: Chang I-mou, Ma Fung Kwok, Youth Film Studio, Beijing Film Academy and Sil-Metropole Organisation
results.brief_description: Set in a small Chinese village, ‘The Story of Qiu Ju’ follows one woman’s crusade to seek justice from the village chief who assaults her husband, Qing Lai, after an argument over Qing’s request to build a shed for drying chilies on prime farming land. Her determination leads her to take on the entire Chinese legal system. A departure from Yimou’s earlier visually sumptuous, period dramas ‘Raise the Red Lantern’ and ‘Ju Dou’, this film adopts a plainer visual style and a satrical tone in observations of contemporary Chinese life and its critique of an overblown and hopelessly ineffective government bureacracy. Based on the novel ‘The Wan Family’s Lawsuit’ by Chen Yuan Bin. Cast includes Gong Li and Lei Que Sheng. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Land without music
results.creator_credit: Walter Forde, Max Schach, Capitol Film Corporation and J H Productions
results.brief_description: A light-hearted operetta composed by Oscar Straus and adapted for the screen by Rudolf Bernauer based on a supposedly true story that took place in the early part of the 19th century. It is a tale of forbidden music where no instruments or singing is allowed in order that the townsfolk can concentrate on more serious things such as making money to pay off the town’s debts. Stars Richard Tauber as Mario Carlini and features Jimmy Durante (Schnozzle) as Jonah J. Whistler. Cast also includes Diana Napier (Princess Regent), June Clyde (Sadie Whistler), Derrick de Marney (Rudolpho Strozzi, Esme Percy (Austrian Ambassador).
